summary: The Direct Medical Care Freedom Act of 2025 amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals with direct medical care service arrangements (where care is provided for a fixed periodic fee) to remain eligible for health savings accounts (HSAs). It defines "direct medical care service arrangement," specifying that it includes arrangements with primary care, specialists, etc. It also clarifies that fees for these arrangements are considered medical expenses and mandates reporting of these fees on W-2 forms when offered through employment. The amendments are effective for months beginning after December 31, 2024.
